definition: Zunyi conference of January 1935 before the Long March
to observe/to obey/to follow/to comply with
justice/righteousness/meaning/foster (father etc)/adopted/artificial (tooth, limb etc)/relationship/friendship
surname Yi/(Tw) abbr. for 義大利|义大利[Yi4 da4 li4], Italy
to balance an account/accountancy/accounting
can/to be possible/to be able to/will/to be likely to/to be sure to/to assemble/to meet/to gather/to see/union/group/association/CL:個|个[ge4]/a moment (Taiwan pr. for this sense is [hui3])
to comment on/to discuss/to suggest

sentences.english: But for the Zunyi Meeting, we couldn't have met each other in Wenzhou today.
sentences.chinese: 如果没有遵义会议，今天我们不可能在温州见面。

sentences.english: The meeting with Jack Ma after the forum was later described by Jet Li himself as "the Zunyi Conference".
sentences.chinese: 会后与马壬因聚会被他企己后来汝容为“遵义会议”。

sentences.english: After conference of abide by justice, he is restored post, lead troop day is fought on north.
sentences.chinese: 遵义会议以后，他被恢复职务，带领部队北上抗日。

definition: Nanchang Uprising, 1st August 1927, the beginning of military revolt by the Communists in the Chinese Civil War
Autumn Harvest Uprising (1927), insurrection in Hunan and Jiangxi provinces led by Mao Zedong
communist attack against the Guomindang's encircle and annihilate campaign
Zhang Guotao (1897-1979), Chinese communist leader in the 1920s and 1930s, defected to Guomindang in 1938
Zhu De (1886-1976), communist leader and founder of the People's Liberation Army
Mao Zedong (1893-1976), Chinese communist leader
Zhang Wentian (1900-1976), CCP party leader and theorist
Chinese Soviet Republic (1931-1937)
pinyin: Zhong1 hua2 Su1 wei2 ai1 Gong4 he2 guo2

definition: He Long (1896-1969), important communist military leader, died from persecution during the Cultural Revolution

Peng Dehuai (1898-1974), top communist general, subsequently politician and politburo member, disgraced after attacking Mao's failed policies in 1959, and died after extensive persecution during the Cultural Revolution
Yang Shangkun (1907-1998), former president of PRC and military leader
Communist Party of China
Liu Shaoqi (1898-1969), Chinese communist leader, a martyr of the Cultural Revolution
Li Xiannian (1909-1992), PRC general and politician
Long March (retreat of the Red Army 1934-1935)
expedition/long journey
United Front (either of the two alliances between the Guomindang and the Communist Party, 1923-1927 and 1937-1945)
